CurrentProjects: ACM hosts several hackathons every year, which provide students an opportunity to create projects in teams. In addition, ACM hosts multiple events every week, including workshops, industry speaker events, AI events, cybersecurity events, professional development help, and interview practice.
AboutUs: ACM is Santa Clara’s premiere organization for students passionate about the field of computer science. Through workshops, hackathons, and projects, our goal for our members is to develop real-world CS skills and experience, to promote professional development through jobs and internships, and to cultivate a tight-knit, collaborative community.
We seek to follow the example set by the early Christian church described in Acts 2:42. We meet every week to study God's word through teaching and group discussions.

CurrentProjects: We work with the Ujima Adult and Family Services to connect our students to the larger Bay Area African community
AboutUs: the African Student Association (ASA) is a club committed to celebrating the African diaspora through our culture and heritage. We are open to any Black-identifying students from all parts of the diaspora and aim to educate and celebrate our cultures.
AGES is a Graduate Engineering Students Community.

CurrentProjects: -Brain AI - use machine learning and EEG to determine the emotional state of a person -Local Businesses - working with local businesses to improve their business models
AboutUs: The mission of AI Collaborate is to teach, create and grow a community of people interested in AI. For those who want to code, we will teach how to program artificial intelligence. For those interested in the concept, we will host idea labs to brainstorm creative ways we can solve local, personal, or global problems with the power of AI.

CurrentProjects: Annual Service Care Package Event Professional Headshots Basketball Tournament Fundraiser Various DE&I Initiatives.
AboutUs: Alpha Kappa Psi is the nation’s oldest and largest co-ed professional business fraternity on campus. Since AKPsi’s founding in 1904, we have grown to 230 active chapters and have initiated over 278,000 brothers. The Psi Omega chapter at Santa Clara University was founded in 2005 and includes over 80 active brothers in the College of Arts & Sciences, Leavey School of Business, and School of Engineering. We strive to hold up our core values - unity, service, integrity, and brotherhood to continue being recognized as the premier developer of business leaders.

CurrentProjects: Service Projects
AboutUs: This Chapter shall be a Service Fraternity under the policies, principles, and provisions set forth in the National Articles of Incorporation, National Bylaws, Standard Chapter Articles of Association, and other policies of Alpha Phi Omega, National Service Fraternity (referred to as “the Fraternity”).

APO is a national theatre honor society that Theatre Arts Majors can accrue enough production point to be inducted into. On the SCU campus APO organized activities for all students to be involved in including the Welcome Weekend Show, Mayer Theatre lock-in, Theatre Arts Prom and student showcase cabarets.

The American Civil Liberties Union at Santa Clara University works to preserve and guarantee the protections of the Constitution’s Bill of Rights. We aim to extend these freedoms to segments of our population who have traditionally been denied their rights, including people of color; lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender people; women; mental-health patients; prisoners; people with disabilities; and the poor. Description: As a student chapter of the National ACLU, our goal is to inspire young lawyers to recognize the need for position action towards protecting liberties and expanding awareness of civil and human rights issues. As a non-partisan organization, the ACLU’s activism spans the full political spectrum. Whether you consider yourself “Liberal” or “Conservative”, the ACLU fights to protect your individual civil liberties. Join us this year for some spirited debates and controversial conversations as we explore the important issues affecting us all.

NationalOrganization: American Constitution Society for Law and Policy
AboutUs: The American Constitution Society for Law and Policy (ACS) promotes the vitality of the U.S. Constitution and the fundamental values it expresses: individual rights and liberties, genuine equality, access to justice, democracy, and the rule of law. These abiding principles are reflected in the vision of the Constitution’s framers and in the wisdom of forward-looking leaders who have shaped our law throughout American history. As a result of their efforts, the Constitution has retained its authority and relevance for each new generation. The American Constitution Society embraces the progress our nation has made toward full embodiment of the Constitution’s core values. ACS believes that law can and should be a force for improving the lives of all people. We are revitalizing and transforming legal and policy debates in classrooms, courtrooms, legislatures and the media, and we are building a diverse and dynamic network of people committed to justice. The Santa Clara University School of Law chapter of the American Constitution Society aims to encourage debate and discussion with the purpose of promoting progressive law and policy in the United States.

ClubName: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics
CurrentProjects: CanSat Project Team
AboutUs: The Santa Clara chapter of AIAA connects SCU students with the largest national aeronautical and aerospace organization with over 35,000 national members and over 190 active student branches. Its goal is to educate undergraduate engineers in the control, operation, construction, and maintenance of quad-copters, satellites, propulsion systems, drones, and other air and space vehicles. It accomplishes these goals by hosting quarterly design competitions, inviting members to attend regional aerospace informational/networking sessions, working with our hand-built aerial vehicles, and by touring various facilities in Northern California related to aerospace systems.

CurrentProjects: We are currently working on introducing and teaching others about the Deaf language and culture. Eventually, we plan to find more accessible ways to advocate and reach out to local Deaf communities in our area!
AboutUs: The American Sign Language Club is a club that will introduce a new language and educate about Deaf culture to the students and faculty members of Santa Clara University. Our mission is to get American Sign Language as an accepted language on campus as well as promote the language and culture to those who would like the opportunity to learn it. Through activities and events, we will engage students in the culture and language and immerse ourselves in the Deaf community. Most importantly, we will have fun!
A club for mechanical engineering students to connect with each other, learn new professional and engineering skills, and explore potential careers via industry events.

Asian-Pacific American Law Student Association - As one of the largest law student organizations at Santa Clara University School of Law, we strive to act as a resource for students to help them enrich their law school experience. APALSA offers an internal mentor-mentee program where first-year law students are paired up with an upper division law student to offer advice and insights about the 1L experience. In addition, APALSA participates in an external mentorship program with the Asian Pacific American Bar Association of Silicon Valley. Students have the opportunity to attend the Annual Bay Area APALSA Conference hosted by one of the 8 Northern California APALSA each year. Every year, this full-day conference highlights current legal issues facing the Asian Pacific American community and brings together law students from all over the Bay Area, as well as prominent Asian Pacific American attorneys. Throughout the year, we organize general meetings, lunch-time panels, cultural events, and community service projects. We also provide our members with many professional and social opportunities to meet other law students, attorneys, and judges in the greater Bay Area legal community.

The Armenian Students Association aims to create a space where Armenian students as well as those interested in the Armenian culture can learn and enjoy Armenian heritage. We also aim to help the Armenian cause by spreading awareness about Armenian related topics.

The Art Law Society was launched in 2021 with the mission to facilitate conversations among art law students, practitioners, and artists by hosting a variety of lectures and panel presentations. Our hope is to provide a forum at SCU Law for the discussion of a depth of art law topics. In addition, the Art Law Society plans to organize tours of local museums, galleries, and auction houses to immerse students in California’s vibrant art scene.

The Artificial Intelligence Student Association is designed to bring law, engineering, and business students together to discuss and learn about Artificial Intelligence in a variety of fields and settings. Through a combination of speaker and student engagement, this organization seeks to promote awareness of the uses of AI as students begin new careers and prepare for ‘the workforce of the future.’ Founded in the fall of 2017, the AI Club has coordinated several speaker events to educate the Santa Clara University graduate student body about Artificial Intelligence uses in organizations such as IBM, Silicon Valley AI (related to healthcare), Silicon Valley Law Group, and more.

ChatChannel: We have a Discord! Please come to a gen meeting to get the link.
AboutUs: APSU promotes awareness, understanding, and appreciation of the diversity of Asian Pacific Islander American (APIA) identities, heritages, and cultures. We hold a safe space for APIA students and other students of color with our weekly general meetings and various events.

CurrentProjects: Associated Schools of Construction Student Competition
AboutUs: AGC provides SCU students of all majors access to Construction Management education, real-world experience, and networking opportunities to expose them to and best prepare them for a career in Construction Management. This education is used to prepare students for attending the annual Associated Schools of Construction (ASC) competition in Sparks, Nevada.

ClubName: Association for Computing Machinery - Women's Chapter
CurrentProjects: • Professional development workshops • Academic and technical workshops • Networking events with industry representatives • Mentorship events • Women's March • Grace Hopper Conference
AboutUs: Santa Clara University’s ACM-W chapter aims to support and advocate for the full engagement of women in all aspects of the computing field. We work to create an environment where women can learn from one another and become passionate about being computer scientists, whether it be through workshops focused on developing academic and professional skills or mentorship events with SCU alumnae and local industry representatives. SCU alumnae remain connected to our ACM-W community well beyond graduation, allowing our current members to learn from and become empowered by those who have come before them. We continue to address the issue of retention of women in computer science and engineering and hope to inspire our members to pursue their goals through knowledge and education about women's contribution to technology.
Ballet Folklorico de SCU is a dance/performing arts club dedicated to showcasing the beauty of Mexican culture through Mexican folkloric dance.

CurrentProjects: Informal - reach out to join music network/jam/perform
AboutUs: Music performance group of la Musica regional de Mexico

The mission of Barkada of Santa Clara University (hereinafter referred to as Barkada of SCU) is to promote the awareness of the Filipino culture and community on the SCU campus through education, networking, social justice, and social activities/events while upholding its heritage, traditions, and relationships.

ClubName: Be the Match On Campus SCU
CurrentProjects: Be the Match SCU is committed to helping patients affected by: - Hosting campus-wide donor registries and fundraising events to give the entire student body the opportunity to join in this social movement and global effort - Increasing awareness regarding the need for young, committed, racially and ethnically diverse registry members who can save a life - Providing opportunities for students to learn about blood cancers and other life-threatening diseases treated by a marrow transplant
AboutUs: Every year, more than 10,000 patients in the US are diagnosed with life-threatening blood diseases such as leukemia and their best option for a cure is a bone marrow transplant. Because 70% of patients do not have a familial match, they depend on donors from the national registry to save their lives.

CurrentProjects: We plan multiple service events per quarter like creek cleanups with Keep Coyote Creek Beautiful, making sandwiches for the Bill Wilson Center, volunteering at food pantries and soup kitchens like Second Harvest Food Bank, CityTeam San Jose, and Martha’s Kitchen, letter writing for women diagnosed with breast cancer, tutoring students at Santa Maria Urban Ministry, and more! Additionally, we plan quarterly fundraisers and drives to raise money and products for period poverty and the local food pantries we work with.
AboutUs: The Belles Service Organization exists as a community for empowered female identifying and gender non-conforming students. We aim to create fulfilling, genuine relationships and promote social justice in the Santa Clara community through direct service actions and involvement. Our pillars of Service, Solidarity, Compassion, and Character inspire us to be engaged servant-leaders within the Belles, Santa Clara University, and the communities we serve.

The Biomedical Engineering Society at Santa Clara University is dedicated to promoting bioengineering and the biomedical sciences through study, research, and discussion of current technological advances and issues in the biomedical field. Some of our club activities include hosting a faculty speaker series, alumni panels, and bringing in companies to talk about different parts of the fields and potential opportunities for students.
Our goal is to promote, educate, and spread the love for birding in the SCU community through fun events outdoor to facilitate bird-watching.
Together we work to create a supportive and driven community of young Black minds that aspire to develop personally and professionally.

The Blockchain and Compliance Legal Society (BCLS) facilitates the intersection of Blockchain (including but not limited to cryptocurrency) and legal compliance. BCLS aims to: Increase student awareness and involvement in the emerging Blockchain-related legal field; Contribute to the career decisions of students interested in Blockchain compliance; Be a vehicle for entry into the Blockchain industry; While, providing connections to Blockchain professionals including (but not limited to) Santa Clara University School of law Alumni.

CurrentProjects: ETHSF Hackathon

AboutUs: "Our organization works with SCU law administration to encourage/include cultural competency within the curriculum, pushes for mandatory implicit bias trainings for faculty, admin, and students, and strategizes with admin to secure more scholarship funding geared towards supporting African American students in their law school endeavors. "

CurrentProjects: Work on an a possible international shipment!
AboutUs: We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to addressing global healthcare inequalities by reallocating excess unused medical supplies-that would otherwise be discarded-from U.S. hospitals and suppliers to areas in need domestically and internationally. We are a student-run nonprofit with 8+ chapters nationwide!

Bread Lover's Club is dedicated to furthering the bread agenda one mouth at a time, creating a social space for folks to discover their passion and other cultures through a unifying love of bread. We also discuss the various forms of bread, not limited to cake, orange chicken, and tortillas.
The purpose of the Bronco Foodie Club is to bring the Bronco Community together for networking over our shared interest in all things food related.

The Organization aims to provide a space where students who believe that life should be respected from conception to natural death can express themselves, engage in advocacy, and socialize. The organization opposes euthanasia, abortion, assisted suicide, the death penalty, and any other attempts to justify the ending of someone’s life. The organization also advocates for a respectful dialogue with individuals who have differing positions on these controversial topics.

Our club is for people who are interested in the ancient world and want to raise awareness of the ancient world. We engage in campus-based activities that educate and entertain the SCU community through the exploration of the ancient world and its influence on our lives.

ClubName: Camp Kesem at Santa Clara University
CurrentProjects: Creating and planning camp activities for next summer, recruiting camper families, recruiting and training counselors for camp session, and having fun!
AboutUs: Camp Kesem provides year-round support to children impacted by a parent's cancer. SCU students can participate in our FREE week-long summer camp and join weekly meetings to support our year-round goals like hosting reunions, and writing birthday cards to campers!

CurrentProjects: We host weekly game nights for casual games and do
AboutUs: The Card Game Club aims to provide a safe and welcoming environment for members of the SCU community to play card games and meet other people. The Card Game Club will help foster genuine relationships through friendly competition and having fun together. We are also aiming to expand the awareness of different card games by engaging those not familiar, and teaching them how to play.

We are a club under the Multicultural Center (MCC) where students can come and learn about Chinese culture. We look to build a community among students by utilizing our common interest in, background, and/or relationship with Chinese language and culture. We hope to maintain a space where students can connect, grow, and learn from each other!!!
Helping Chinese students and host events for them

CurrentProjects: We strive to host diverse events for students to build their networks with attorneys from big law, small firms, and in-house legal departments. We also provide a mentorship program in collaboration with ChIPs Silicon Valley, connecting students with each other and with attorneys in the Silicon Valley.
AboutUs: ChIPs is a nonprofit organization that advances and connects women in technology, law, and policy. We seek to accelerate innovation through diversity of thought, participation, and engagement.

CurrentProjects: DIY Crafts
AboutUs: Clara Craft Club is Santa Clara University's craft club where we create fun, DIY crafts!

CurrentProjects: Hosting guest speaker events and fundraisers.
AboutUs: Club Bio’s mission is to foster an inclusive community of students who love the field of science. We intend to host social events for members and informative sessions with guest speakers to allow students of all backgrounds to bond over their shared passion for biology.

CurrentProjects: Service Small Groups
AboutUs: To lead Broncos to Christ through the joy of faith, fellowship, and discipleship in their everyday life. College Catholics welcomes all individuals from all walks of life seeking to discover and share the love of God. Our mission is more than a building but a relationship with Christ’s love and one another. Join us at our Monday night meetings at 7 PM, bible studies, and sacramental events!

The Commuter Student Union is a registered student organization (RSO) for commuter students and offers a "home away from home" for those who do not live on campus. They have get-togethers and social activities as well as provide support for one another.

We're a community of Christians who want to grow closer to Jesus together. We meet weekly on Tuesday nights to sing worship songs and study the Bible, and we have events throughout the quarter to further promote connection within our community.

We are law students with academic and professional interests in the criminal law field. Our goal is to provide opportunities for Santa Clara Law students to network with professionals and other students, to learn more about the field of criminal law, and to experience the different perspectives of those within the criminal law arena. We also provide resources and support for those interested in pursuing a career in criminal law.
Our club aims to promote and Italian American culture within the SCU community through a multitude of social, institutional, and educational events.

CurrentProjects: Every quarter our dance team holds practices to film dance covers and prepare performances to popular K-Pop songs!
AboutUs: DayBreak is a K-Pop Dance Crew where people can come together and share their love for K-Pop through dance. As a club, we give DayBreak members the opportunity to participate in dance covers, performances, and larger social events that promote community and teamwork!

CurrentProjects: We just released a dance cover to Stray Kids 'Thunderous'! We also successfully held our first dance showcase 'Break The Day!' with guest performer Ballet Folklorico!
AboutUs: DayBreak is a KPOP Cover Dance Crew where people can come together and learn various Kpop dances at weekly workshops. Members of DayBreak also have the opportunity to participate in dance covers, performances, and larger social events that will promote community and teamwork!

CurrentProjects: Recruitment every Fall and Spring quarter! Follow us on Instagram to learn more (@dem_alphaomicron)
AboutUs: Delta Epsilon Mu (DEM) is the nation's premier Professional Pre-Health Co-Ed Fraternity. DEM exists to provide an informative, educational, and social setting for all pre-health students across medicine, dentistry, nursing, psychology, veterinary studies, etc. We strive to employ our principles of dedication, loyalty, friendship, and support in all of our efforts.

The Gamma Xi chapter of Delta Sigma Pi is the premier co-ed professional fraternity at Santa Clara University. Founded in 1997, our chapter has been committed to creating the next generation of holistic and conscientious business professionals, helping members grow their professional networks, develop their business acumen and reignite their passion for philanthropy.

CurrentProjects: Currently, the club is working on a few tap routines in order to be able to perform for Hipnotik's Spring Showcase in late May! We are also choreographing performances for Fall 2022 because there are many on-campus events during the first quarter, including Love Jones!
AboutUs: Dynamic Rhythm is SCU's only self-led and self-choreographed tap dancing club on campus. This club seeks to foster a creative and safe space for students to express themselves through tap dancing, while also building close relationships with other group members within the dance community.

CurrentProjects: Our club currently works on organizing networking and learning opportunities for economics majors and minors, or people who want to learn more about the field of economics. Our most recent project was hosting the former Federal Trade Commissioner for a speaker event on campus. We also collaborate with the career center, professors to share their research, and alumni to talk about their career.
AboutUs: The SCU Student Economics Association is a student organization dedicated to offering opportunities to students of all majors/minors at Santa Clara University. The association works to organize enjoyable and enriching events and activities that are designed to help students build relationships with professors, alumni, and each other.

CurrentProjects: We are aiming to design an efficient and cost effective irrigation system to water seedlings for the local non-profit organization, Valley Verde. In addition, we are working to provide a secure and sustainable drinking-water system that can filter for bacteria, parasites, turbidity, and nitrates, and control water distribution for a community in Nyange, Rwanda.
AboutUs: We apply technical knowledge to solve pressing challenges in developing communities, while providing SCU students with real project experience. With active long-term projects in Nyange, Rwanda and San Jose, California, students experience the entire project process — from identifying a problem to ideating solutions to implementing the final product. Throughout the academic year, students communicate with the partner community to address their needs, design and prototype solutions, and iterate and test designs. These projects, though entirely student run, are held to the EWB National model and on-campus faculty reviews. This ensures project sustainability, and reinforces the importance of thorough design practices.

CurrentProjects: This coming year our team will be working on a germination chamber for a non profit called Valley Verde in San Jose along with finishing a multi-year water project for a community in Nyange, Rwanda.
AboutUs: Our members are the next generation of responsible, humanitarian engineering leaders. We empower technically competent, empathetic, and ethical engineering leaders by supporting community-driven development through the implementation of sustainable, user-centric solutions aimed to solve pressing challenges in developing communities.

The Environmental Law Society’s mission is to promote environmental awareness on the Santa Clara campus and in the surrounding community. It also encourages students to pursue careers in environmental law by sponsoring educational and networking events on current topics in environmental law.

EQSCU is an educational and support organization that provides educational and career resources, networking opportunities, and a social support system. The group also works to increase awareness of the concerns of bisexuals, gays, lesbians and transgender persons within the law school. We hold regular meetings, sponsor final exam review sessions, support activism, invite speakers to the law school, and represent Santa Clara Law at national and local LGBT legal conferences, and career fairs. We also serve as a bridge between current law students, LGBT law school alumni, and SF Bay Area LGBT legal professionals.

The Ethnic Studies Club is a club centralizing community open to students of all disciplines. In this club, students are to engage in community activism, foster dialogue on campus around themes of intersectionality and racial justice, integrate equity and justice into their daily lives, and become a space of solidarity and connectedness.
To provide a welcoming community where people are able to learn about French culture and meet new people with similar interests.
ContactName: Claire Andreski, President. Other best contact person: Maena Houssier, Vice President

AboutUs: The mission of Future Child Advocates is to increase public awareness about child related injustices, engage in professional development for students who intend to work with children, facilitate child-focused community service, and support child related advocacy and fundraising activities.

CurrentProjects: we are currently working with two small businesses helping them build websites and create a stronger online brand through ads and SEO.
AboutUs: GetVirtual gives local businesses affected by COVID-19 the tools to adapt to the virtual landscape and extend their businesses online.

CurrentProjects: "FP&A and Data Science Tools."
AboutUs: The Graduate Finance Club vision is to create a platform for graduate business students to explore and learn about finance, while networking with like-minded peers and finance professionals.

CurrentProjects: No projects currently underway at this time.
AboutUs: The Graduate Real Estate Club purpose is to provide SCU graduate business students opportunities to learn about career options in real estate, develop and hone the skills necessary to pursue those career options, to network with industry professionals, and to hear about the latest trends and technologies in the real estate industry from leaders on the cutting edge of the field.
We are a sustainability club focused on promoting sustainable action and organization on campus.

CurrentProjects: falls under the MCC and we organize community service each quarter but have a banquet upcoming to transition board
AboutUs: Welcoming community for any latine or hispanic identifying individual

CurrentProjects: Food Outreach Events at Columbus Park and clothing drives near the end of every quarter.
AboutUs: Our mission is to provide support, resources, and compassion for local homeless individuals and other underrepresented Santa Clara County community groups.
We host events and help both undergraduate and graduate Chinese students, celebrating Chinese and International festivals.

CurrentProjects: Listened to speakers VP Kamala Harris, Prof. Morlang on transnational immigration, Prof. Leung on the primaries, collaboration with UCLA Ignite chapter on voting rights, social events, etc.
AboutUs: IGNITE is a nonpartisan political action organization aimed to empower women to be involved in politics whether that's by improving voter turnout or running for office.

CurrentProjects: Love Jones, Igwe Culture Show, Igwe Formal, Black Bronco Network
AboutUs: Igwebuike is one of the 16 clubs in the MultiCultural Center (MCC). We serve as a space for all Black-Identifying and Pan-African students on campus, who are looking for community and a place to get involved on campus.

ClubName: Information Systems and Analytics Student Network
AboutUs: Santa Clara University’s ISA Student Network (ISN), housed in the Information Systems and Analytics department is for students interested in opportunities intersecting business and technology!

Intandesh's mission is to provide a safe space for people of South Asian descent including but not limited to Indian, Pakistani, Sri Lankan, and Bangladeshi. Intandesh serves simply as a platform for undergraduate students of South Asian descent to share interests, ideas, and personal backgrounds. We do this by hosting events such as Diwali, Culture Show, Mock Shaadi, and Holi which showcase South Asian Culture.
A community and social network for Santa Clara University International Students and Alumni. All are welcome!

CurrentProjects: We work on - speaker presentations/panels; networking/coffee chats between students and industry volunteers; job board: ilsojobs.com
AboutUs: The Internet Law Student Organization (ILSO) was created to raise awareness and spark interest about Internet Law and the theoretical and practical dilemmas that arise when applying laws to rapidly developing technologies.

CurrentProjects: "We are doing virtual events with employers including resume reviews, company overviews, and information sessions on what information systems and analytics majors entail and possible job fields. We also host an annual Bronco Hackathon near the end of the year. "
AboutUs: The ISA Student Network provides the tools and resources necessary for OMIS undergraduates to grow their skills technically, professionally and personally

CurrentProjects: Matsuri Cultural Festival
AboutUs: The Japanese Student Association (JSA) celebrates Japanese heritage while striving to promote education and awareness for various aspects of the country, all while providing a homey community for anyone who wants to cultivate their interests in Japanese culture. Through cultural presentations and events, JSA aims to create a deeper understanding of the nation’s rich history and contemporary environment, sharing a slice of Japan with the Santa Clara University student body.

CurrentProjects: Monthly on campus shabbats, israel and Jewish education, community building
AboutUs: A community where anyone can celebrate, learn about, and express Jewish culture and faith at Santa Clara University

Ka Mana’o O Hawai’i serves to promote fellowship among students of Hawai'i and students interested in the culture of Hawai'i at SCU. We strive to create an awareness, understanding, and appreciation of the local and Native Hawaiian culture within the university community.

Klesis is a Greek word that means “divine invitation.” College is full of invitations, but this is a special one. At Klesis, you’ll find a safe space to seek answers to life's big questions while building lasting friendships. Throughout the week we “do life” together - studying the Bible, hanging out, eating lots of good food, going on fun trips, and lots more.

The purpose of Korean Student Association (KSA) shall be to unify students of Santa Clara University that identify ethnically as Korean while promoting Korean traditions and heritage to students who are interested in exploring and learning Korean culture.
The purpose of the Society shall be to promote academic excellence, service, and leadership through the application of the artistic, humanistic, and scientific principles of communication.

CurrentProjects: We are working on having small groups for select languages, as well as collaborating with Study Abroad at SCU to prepare students on their journey overseas!
AboutUs: Have a passion for languages? Currently learning or want to learn a new language and need  some practice with native speakers or other learners? Come join the SCU Language Learning Club! Learn tips and tricks on how to improve your own language acquisition, discuss the history and culture behind languages and get ready to have meaningful conversations! Our club meets once a week and has an active discord for online chats to keep the learning going! * We are open to speakers of all levels.

The LatinX Business Student Association is a student-led organization dedicated to empowering Latinx students interested in business by providing resources, networking opportunities, and a supportive community to help them achieve their goals and succeed in their professional endeavors.

CurrentProjects: Cultural Shows, Outreach Events, Raices, Gala, Other Multicultural Involvement
AboutUs: We aim to unify and give voice to the Latinx community and our allies to create a safe, inclusive, and respectful space where we can organize together and empower each other. We strive to accomplish this by: - Fostering a community of current SCU students, alumni, faculty, workers, etc... - Creating and maintaining an open channel of communication within our community to facilitate awareness, discussion, and activism. - Celebrating all Latin American cultures and experiences.
ContactName: Co-Chairs: Brayan Perez, Natalia Ochoa Zavala

CurrentProjects: Attorney panel events - hosting Fenwick and Cooley (w/ ChIPs).
AboutUs: The Santa Clara University Law & Business Society is for students who are interested in the intersection of law and business. The Society will focus on two areas – (1) Business Law (Corporate Mergers and Acquisitions, Venture Capital, Emerging Companies, etc.); and (2) Law as a Business (Opening, Running, and Managing a Law Firm). The Society will invite attorneys and business leaders to discuss current business law and policy at various events.

CurrentProjects: "Afrotech: AfroTech World is a virtual conference and continues to be one of the largest multicultural tech conferences in the United States, bringing together engineers, venture capitalists, recruiters, technologists, and culture enthusiasts from all over the world. It is the definitive conference that brings leaders in technology and business together to exchange ideas and build a strong Black tech community."
AboutUs: LBBA's mission is to support African American/Black students and other underrepresented groups with their business affiliated aspirations through professional exposure, professional development opportunities, and community involvement.

ClubName: LSBISA - Leavey School of Business International Student Association
CurrentProjects: "We will have a peer mentorship  event at the end of October designed for newly enrolled international students to get engaged. "
AboutUs: Leavey School of Business International Student Association (LSBISA) provides a platform for both international and the U.S. students with networking opportunities for multi-culture sharing and learning, and mentorship for study and career build-up. Santa Clara University is strengthened by its international talented students, distinguished researchers, and dedicated alumni. A strong international student body is a crucial part of the education of future leaders and global citizens.

ClubName: Mathematics and Computer Science Society of Santa Clara University
CurrentProjects: Mentorship Program
AboutUs: The Math/CS Society plans social, academic, and professional events for Math and Computer Science majors and minors at Santa Clara University. The goal of the club is to bolster the community both within and surrounding the department, providing greater opportunities for friendships, mentoring, and networking for people with similar interests and goals.

CurrentProjects: Collaboration with Associate Dean and GPC
AboutUs: The MBA Student Advisory Council serves as a liaison between Santa Clara University Leavey School of Business Evening MBA students and the administration and faculty.

CurrentProjects: We are currently partnering with the national microfinance organization, Kiva.
AboutUs: We are committed to promote microfinance within the SCU community and assist local nonprofits to alleviate extreme poverty by designing microfinance programs and providing microfinance loans to entrepreneurs.
ContactName: Meili Tompson, Co-President and Cynthia Hong, Co-President (for the 2024-2025 school year)

CurrentProjects: We are currently in the process of rebranding our club's title to SWANA.
AboutUs: The Middle Eastern North African Club (MENA) is a cultural club that represents a collective of countries from the MENA region. We aim to foster community, positive conversations, and collaboration in various subjects including culture and social change. We organize on and off-campus events for our members to connect with other students and RSOs on campus.

The Muslim Student Association is a safe place for all Muslims and allies to the Muslim community at Santa Clara University. MSA is devoted to facilitating interaction and growing experiences for those identifying as Muslim and people of other belief systems who are allies of the Muslim community.

The National Society of Black Engineers is focused on increasing the number of culturally responsible black engineers who succeed academically, excel professionally, and positively impact the community. Our chapter works to support our members while also utilizing our resources and connections to younger students learn about engineering. We host general meetings where we invite professional engineers to our members and discuss internship/job opportunities. These meetings also include professional development workshops (resume writing, elevator pitch, interviewing skills, etc.) to help our members find job opportunities in their field. Additionally, we have one or two social events a quarter to help build relationships within our organization. Every quarter we host an outreach event where we lead younger African-American students in an engineering workshop, student panels, and tours of our campus so that they can learn about engineering and life at SCU.

CurrentProjects: Santa Clara Powwow, Indigenous People's Day Celebration, Hour of Remembrance at the Mission Cemetery, Hygiene Item Distribution
AboutUs: The Native American Coalition for Change (NACC)  supports Native American students at Santa Clara University and in the Bay Area while working to be a positive force in the community. NACC was founded in 2016 and looks forward to expanding its positive impact on the community through its annual powwow, events, and community service.

CurrentProjects: "Our goal of this year is to come up with a non-profit startup idea to solve a social problem and pitch it to some incubators, such as Fast Forward in 2021. "
AboutUs: Net Impact strives to inspire and equip emerging leaders to build a more just and sustainable world. There are 400+ chapters in nearly 40 countries that reach tens of thousands of individuals and make an impact on some of the most pressing issues of our time. We are the graduate Net Impact Chapter at Santa Clara University and our goal is to bring positive change to the world’s most pressing challenges with the help of SCU’s students.

Net Impact strives to inspire and equip emerging leaders to build a more just and sustainable world. There are 400+ chapters in nearly 40 countries that reach tens of thousands of individuals and make an impact on some of the most pressing issues of our time. Our Clubs vision is to create a platform for SCU graduate students to explore real-world challenges, to learn how to drive measurable change from industry leaders, and to network with like-minded peers and professionals.

CurrentProjects: neuroscience Career panels, club social "meet and greets"
AboutUs: The purpose of Neuroscience Club is to provide a space for those interested in learning about a range of topics related to the brain. We will bring in a variety of speakers to talk on the interdisciplinary applications of neuroscience in research and careers. Events held on campus will encompass sharing information about the brain such as anatomy, physiology, disorders and diseases, and the ways neuroscience is applied to other fields of science, engineering, business, and arts. Additionally, Neuro Club will promote the neuroscience major and program on the SCU campus.

New Life on Campus is a Bible study dedicated to growing people to become fully devoted followers of Jesus Christ. We achieve that end by helping people learn how to study and apply the Bible for themselves and seeking to form a Christ-centered community. Whether you’re a person exploring Christianity for the first time or looking to grow deeper in your faith, we encourage you on that journey.

ORCA's mission is to educate Santa Clara University about water pollution and create positive change by enacting sustainable solutions to water pollution within our community. We are dedicated to protecting marine life along the California coast and securing a sustainable future for all.

CurrentProjects: Current projects of ORCA involve phasing out unsustainable fishing gear like Set Gillnets off the coast of California, addressing pollution levels in the waters of Point Reyes National Park, and coordinating collegiate and high school environmental organizations to push for better sustainable legislation for protecting our waterways. https://linktr.ee/californiabycatch
AboutUs: The Ocean and Rivers Conservation Alliance, a Turtle Island Restoration Network program, is one of the first collegiate-based programs that work to protect and restore our rivers and coastline through direct action.  Through relational organizing, ORCA provides its members with networking skills, organizing experience, and the power to make real change. We will work together to create volunteer events that will aide in various environmental campaigns.

CurrentProjects: "Virtual hackathon."
AboutUs: Dedicated to supporting SCU entrepreneurs.

CurrentProjects: "Fundraising (to support Partners In Health's work), Advocacy (fighting for the right to health for everyone), Community Building (educating ourselves and our communities about global health)"
AboutUs: Partners In Health Engage (PIHE) is building the right to health movement as a grassroots organization off of the non-profit Partners In Health. We drive campaigns focused on building and directing power towards generating new resources, fostering public discourse, and advocating for effective policies. We educate by hosting discussion groups and public lectures about the right to health. We generate resources to fund high quality healthcare for people living in poverty. We advocate for global and domestic policies that further the right to health. Together, we demand the right to health be protected for all people, everywhere.

ClubName: Partnership for Animal Welfare and Support (PAWS)
AboutUs: The Partnership for Animal Welfare and Support (PAWS) is a student organization at Santa Clara University bringing together the SCU community and animals in need through volunteer and fundraising efforts.

We are a professional co-ed business fraternity, and are open to all majors. We are the newest business fraternity on the SCU campus. Phi Chi Theta Coeducational National Business Fraternity is dedicated to instilling professionalism in all our endeavors and is a foundational pillar for every brother and sister.

ClubName: Pi Tau Sigma Mechanical Engineering Honor Society
AboutUs: PI TAU SIGMA is the International Honor Society for Mechanical Engineers. Pi Tau Sigma members are chosen on a basis of sound engineering ability, scholarship service, leadership, and integrity. The Pi Tau Sigma mission is to strive to create better engineers through commitment to academic excellence and dedication to service. Pi Tau Sigma prides itself in the core values: Integrity (soundness of character and moral conduct), Service (serving the mechanical engineering profession and the community), and Leadership (fostering initiative through example in a professional manner). Pi Tau Sigma is a member of the Association of College Honor Societies. There are presently 182 collegiate chapters at universities in the United States, Puerto Rico, Mexico, Qatar, and United Arab Emirates.

CurrentProjects: Currently working on playing other neighboring schools in matches and tournaments.
AboutUs: Pickleball Club is a club where people can play Pickleball with other students, compete against other schools, and learn how to play. There will be many different levels of the sport, and people of all degrees can come to play or learn!

CurrentProjects: Speaker events, mentorship, off campus events with legal teams, student panels.
AboutUs: To facilitate undergraduate students who have an interest in being involved in policy based work, and pursuing a legal education through student-planned events and activities for its members and Santa Clara community.

AboutUs: The Pre-PA club at Santa Clara University was established to bring together students that are interested in becoming Physician Assistants, and educated students and the community about the Physician Assistant profession as well as provide opportunites that prepare students for entry to PA school.
Psychology Club provides fun events, academic/career advice, and interesting faculty talks for students who are interested in psychology.

AboutUs: Queer & Qualified is a student organization that focuses on building community and opportunity for LGBTQ+ students across campus, including allies. Our mission is to build advocacy, professional development opportunities, service, support and mentorship for the LGBTQ+ community at SCU.

AboutUs: QPOCA is dedicated to celebrating the unique and diverse experiences of queer people of color on and off the SCU campus.

ContactName: Lucy Walsh - co-president, Kate Grey - Co-president

AboutUs: Recipes for Relief is a group of passionate volunteers who love to cook and provide warm meals for residents of the JW House. The JW House is a low- to no-cost medical hospitality house for families of patients currently receiving care at Kaiser Permanente Santa Clara and other San Francisco Bay Area hospitals. Cooking always begins with a story. Nicholas’ passion for cooking originates from his experience growing up with a rare endocrine growth disorder called Russell Silver Syndrome (RSS). Children diagnosed with this disorder typically display phenotypes of failure to grow independently and severe lack of appetite. At home, Nicholas was deeply involved in the cooking process as a child, and prepared garlic purees, spice blends, and pasta sauce that created unique aromas, textures, and tastes that sparked curiosity in food. This curiosity in food, and ultimately bonding with cooking, helped Nicholas overcome a lack of appetite previously thought to be genetically encoded. For all opportunities and updates, please visit our website: recipesforrelief.com.

CurrentProjects: Working on collaborating with more clubs around campus focused on business or sustainability as well as continuing to reach out to a broader group of companies appealing to all types of students who attend SCU.
AboutUs: The RSSA program holds events for RMI and non-RMI students within the retail space. Our events include professional development workshops, recruiting events with retail companies, and social events to build a community within the program.

CurrentProjects: Resume workshop, interview prep, study hours, peer mentoring, alumni advising

AboutUs: Rho Psi Eta is a pre-health academic sorority that embraces and upholds our pillars of integrity, community service, and sisterhood. We strive to help our young women pursue their interests and goals in the healthcare professions.

AboutUs: RSC is a community for Russian speakers or anyone who wants to hang out with us. Our club aims to connect people with similar backgrounds and create a safe environment for everyone.

AboutUs: We teach various Latinx dances and provide some background on the place of origin and culture of the dance. It provides a safe and welcoming environment for people to embrace their culture and/or learn about new cultures. It's also a great opportunity for people to socialize and get to know new people.

CurrentProjects: Most Recently, we tri-hosted the Bay Area Super Ball, a ballroom / DanceSport Competition with Stanford & Berkeley!  Our team has been growing, as we recently traveled to compete in San Louis Obispo, Claremont, San Diego, Santa Barbara, and more!
AboutUs: Founded in 2022, Santa Clara Ballroom Dance Association brings the SCU community together through offering lessons, performance, and competition opportunities in various styles of Ballroom Dance, spanning International Standard, Latin, American Smooth, Rhythm, and Social Dances. ​ We also offer TRAVEL opportunities to compete, spectate, and support your teammates!

CurrentProjects: Professional Development Opportunities, Engagement/Projects
AboutUs: Santa Clara Consulting (SCC) is a student-run consulting group at Santa Clara University. We are comprised of exceptional undergraduate students at Santa Clara University who serve the community with our innovative and strategic solutions. Contact us: santaclaraconsulting@scu.edu
ContactName: Aditi Bagepalli, President // Davin Patel, VP Internal // Yaseen Elashmawi, President

CurrentProjects: Flashmobs, end of year showcases, choreography
AboutUs: Santa Clara Dance Coalition is a contemporary dance organization with a focus on creativity, technical development and community. Offers opportunities to explore dance through student led classes, master classes and performance and choreography opportunities, with a strong focus on contemporary. We bring together dancers with a love for movement, expression and exploration.

The Santa Clara Entrepreneurship Association (SCEA) is a student organization with the goal of promoting and fostering the entrepreneurial spirit of Silicon Valley on campus. SCEA leverages SCU’s location in the heart of the innovation economy to connect students with local startups and founders through company tours, on campus talks, and workshops designed to support and accelerate student entrepreneurs.

CurrentProjects: Designing and building a car for competition summer of 2025.
AboutUs: Formula SAE is an intercollegiate engineering design competition that is hosted by SAE International. Students from universities around the world design and build a car over the academic year to compete in a series of dynamic and static events against other colleges. The teams are scored throughout these events to determine winners of the competition. The competition also has awards outside of the events that recognize teams for design accomplishments, such as best use of E-85 ethanol fuel and recyclability.

CurrentProjects: Building Santa Clara's first electric car!
AboutUs: Santa Clara Formula SAE Electric provides hands-on engineering experience through the design and construction of a small Formula 1 style racecar. Each year students work together to design an electric racecar to represent Santa Clara in an intercollegiate competition. Members will learn to machine high precision components and will have the opportunity to work with professional software normally unavailable to students. Not an engineer? No problem! Non-engineering majors are encouraged help with business and media sides of the team.

CurrentProjects: - Competitive teams competing in collegiate-level esports competitions for games such as Valorant, League of Legends, and more. - Game nights & casual community gaming events - For-fun watch parties and casual tournaments
AboutUs: SCU Esports houses competitive teams in a variety of popular titles. Some of our most popular titles include League of Legends, Valorant, and Rocket League. Along with this SCU Esports will foster a community of casual and competitive gamers through numerous events throughout the year including but not limited to game nights, esports watch parties, and seasonal for-fun and semi-competitive tournaments.

The Santa Clara Investment Club is a division of the greater Santa Clara Investment Fund. While the Investment Fund involves a selective recruiting process, the Investment Club is open to all students and welcomes everybody no matter their prior knowledge of finance or investing. The Investment Club will focus on introducing students to the world of finance through educational content, guest speakers, and simulated investing. All students of any major and skill level are welcome.

CurrentProjects: Primarily weekly lessons, but we also have exclusive access to most guest speakers and recruiting events on campus. Past events included Bain, Citibank, and more.
AboutUs: The Santa Clara Investment Club is open to all students no matter their prior knowledge of finance or investing. The club focuses on introducing students to the world of finance through educational content, guest speakers, and simulated investing. We teach members the basics of portfolio management, due diligence, and professional development tailored to careers in finance. All students of any major and skill level are welcome. Email santaclarainvestmentclub@gmail.com for more

CurrentProjects: Creating a more mindful and welcoming space
AboutUs: A space where Santa Clara students can gather and find a community centered around mindful living. We meet weekly to learn about and practice different forms of mindfulness and put on various activities to go along with the themes we discuss.

The Santa Clara Rock Climbing Club seeks to bring beginners and veterans of rock climbing together to form a tight community in which they can share their experiences and love for climbing. We are both a recreational and competitive club, allowing those who would like to compete in the US collegiate competitions to participate, while also allowing those who would like to recreationally climb have a community to do so.

We host events such as annual art shows, art iron-chef's, and museum events!

CurrentProjects: Current projects include education on political events through our bi-weekly meetings, as well as work with TuRn, Divestment, and Enact to build stronger sustainability awareness on campus. Sunrise also hopes to bring local government candidates on campus to speak to students about their campaigns for the coming school year.
AboutUs: Santa Clara Sunrise is a sustainability activism group that focuses on the politics of sustainability in the US. We focus on educating the student body on current events in sustainability politics, as well as helping students to register to vote around elections.

ClubName: Santa Clara University Model United Nations
AboutUs: The Santa Clara University Model United Nations chapter is a student-run organization with the guiding principle to strengthen scholarship, diplomacy, and understanding amongst students interested in foreign affairs and international politics. Model United Nations provides students with the opportunity to engage in international politics and translate the knowledge obtained through the organization into action within the greater Santa Clara community and in their chosen career pathways.

CurrentProjects: Through the Science and Engineering Mentoring Outreach (SEMO) program, Santa Clara University students will participate in science education through outreach to a diverse community in the greater San Jose area. In a mutually beneficial collaboration, SCU students will provide higher education role models, STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) career awareness, and soft skill development through mentorship to high school students.
AboutUs: The Science and Engineering Mentoring Outreach (SEMO) Program seeks to provide high school students with higher education role models through mentorship that promotes STEM career awareness and soft skill development. College mentors are selected for their commitment and responsibility towards this cause.

SCU A Cappella consists of five student a cappella groups: 3 SATB (Vocalicious, Audiosync, and Supertonic), one TTBB (Testostertones) and one SSAA (Measure Up). With quarterly performances and several group events per year, this organization gives the opportunity to sing in an organized a cappella group to all students.

CurrentProjects: Currently, our club is involved in creating merchandise to promote a sense of community in Malley, and use the funds for future events. Additionally, we are planning for a local retreat to further help bond our members.
AboutUs: SCU Barbell Club is a gym-based club focusing on group progression through accomplishing our individual weight-lifting or weight-lifting related goals. Here we promote competitions, whether it be powerlifting or bodybuilding, as well as create community through social activities, such as a food run or a game night. Our club is inclusive to all SCU students who are committed to making progress in the gym, which includes but is not limited to: technique, strength, physique, overall fitness, and fitness education progression. To motivate members to progress, as well as create community, we host weekly workouts in Malley and intro to lifting sessions. Additionally, we host several competitions such as our annual pull-up competition, a squat off, bench off, deadlift off, and more. Lastly, we sell merchandise to promote a sense of community with all profits funding our events. Overall, our main objectives are to strengthen the Malley community through Barbell and give members the confidence and knowledge to meet their gym goals.

CurrentProjects: Currently we are having friendly matches with surrounding schools and their billiard clubs.
AboutUs: Our club hopes to enrich our community of players in the game of pool in both a recreational and professional manner. Whether you are just learning or have experience we welcome you to the club.

CurrentProjects: "Rekindling a love of reading for people that used to read but fell out of love with it because of school/time."
AboutUs: Our mission is to ultimately foster a love of reading. We hope that through the club, members will expand their literary horizons, form meaningful friendships, and have fun.

For New or Affluent students with interests in various genre's and sub-genre's of history. We engage in conversation over diverse perspectives, ranging from global settings to local ones. This club is about the martial art of Jiu-Jitsu and self-defense in general. The club consists of people meeting up to talk about, practice, and watch Jiu-Jitsu all while having fun. The purpose is to offer a space for those who practice Jiu-Jitsu but want to stay on campus to train and for those wanting to learn self-defense.

CurrentProjects: Building lightsabers, teaching CAD, 3D printing, laser cutting and more
AboutUs: The Santa Clara University Maker Club is made up of an enthusiastic, diverse group of students with a desire to work with and learn more about the equipment located in the Santa Clara Engineering Maker Laboratory. Students are able to gain the knowledge and training required to use a vast majority of tools including 3D printers, laser cutters, stamp makers, power tools, and more. Students meet in order to collaborate on creative projects and enhance their engineering skills. With the new STEM building opening, we are hoping to expand the Maker Club, and encourage students to harness their own creativity, bringing their projects and ideas to life. Some club activities may include Maker Lab tool certification, t-shirt making, 3D modeling and printing, laser cutting key chains, movie nights, and more! The Maker Club is hoping to get students excited about creating, learning, and teaching to become the innovators of tomorrow.

CurrentProjects: A service learning trip (SLT) to Lima, Peru in Spring of 2023/Beginning of Summer. We are also working on a mentorship campaign with local high schools.
AboutUs: Medlife empowers students and volunteers to become advocates for change by local volunteer campaigns, volunteering in Service Learning Trips, and supporting the Moving Mountains giving program. Our mission is to build a movement that empowers communities to fight for equal access to healthcare, education and safe living.

SCU Motorsport, also known as SCU's car club, is a vibrant community for automobile enthusiasts. The club is committed to promoting and fostering an appreciation for all aspects of cars and driving. Members regularly partake in local car meets, providing an excellent opportunity to connect with fellow enthusiasts, exchange knowledge, and admire a diverse array of vehicles. Additionally, the club organizes group drives, where members can share the joy and thrill of driving in a safe and supportive environment. SCU Motorsport is an inclusive group and extends a warm welcome to everyone interested in cars, regardless of whether they own a vehicle or not. It's a platform where passion for cars transcends ownership, and the shared love for automobiles unites all members.

AboutUs: This club is dedicated to all things Pokemon, from Pokemon Go and Main Series Pokemon Games, to the card game and anyone interested in the world of Pokemon.
