CurrentProjects: What We Do: - Product Workshops: Join us for hands-on workshops where you can learn essential product management skills, user experience design principles, and agile development methodologies. - Guest Speakers: Gain insights from industry experts and successful entrepreneurs who will share their experiences, challenges, and tips for building and launching products that make an impact. - Networking Opportunities: Connect with like-minded peers, faculty, and professionals through networking events, career fairs, and collaborative projects. Hackathons and Competitions: Showcase your creativity and problem-solving abilities in hackathons and product development competitions, where you can put theory into practice. - Product Showcases: Have a product idea or project you'd like to share? Our club provides a platform for you to present your work and receive valuable feedback from the community. - Career Development: Explore career paths in product management, marketing, design, and development. We provide resources and guidance to help you kickstart your journey in the tech and product industry.
AboutUs: Welcome to the Santa Clara University Product Club, where innovation, creativity, and teamwork converge to shape the future of product development! Our club is a vibrant community of students passionate about all things related to product management, design, development, and marketing.
ContactName: Ipsita Bhattacharya, Chair of Product Marketing

CurrentProjects: Real Estate Symposium, Property Tours,
AboutUs: The Santa Clara University Real Estate Association was established in 2016 and serves as the premier Real Estate organization for SCU undergraduates. With over 250 active members, the association connects undergraduate students to all facets of the Real Estate Industry. Members of the association gain an incredible amount of exposure to the field through panel discussions, property tours, networking events, our annual real estate symposium, and more. Our goal is to facilitate learning for students interested in a career in Real Estate and help them succeed in the dynamic industry.

CurrentProjects: Blood drives and volunteer opportunities
AboutUs: We are the liaisons between the Red Cross and Santa Clara University, and we  provide relief and support to those in crisis through fundraising initiatives and volunteering.

CurrentProjects: We have free quarterly shows for the community alongside our weekly practices :)
AboutUs: We are SCU’s best and (only) improvisation comedy club. We have quarterly shows where we play short-form improv games on the fly for the SCU community. We meet every week and play games, act scenes, and have bonding nights! We have open rehearsals for anyone interested in dipping their toe into the hilarious improv pool. We are open for all majors and encourage diversity within our club. If you are interested in humor, acting, or learning all the wonderful skills that come from improv, check us out!

CurrentProjects: Organizing frequent trips to Palisades Tahoe, Mammoth, and more!
AboutUs: We are a group of passionate skiers and snowboarders who organize trips to Lake Tahoe and beyond. We even offer discounted passes, so we hope you'll join us this season!

Santa Clara University's Sports Business is a completely student-run organization which provides students with resources and opportunities to enhance and build a career in the sports industry. This organization explores the intersection of business fundamentals with the entertainment and awe found in athletics. ​Our coordinated efforts with distinguished guest speakers, alumni, and professionals help students gain a better understanding of the duties and responsibilities of a career in the sports marketing, sports management, sports finance, ticket sales, operations, and sports journalism fields.

If you love stand up comedy—watching it, performing it, analyzing it, ANYTHING!—then our club is for you! SCU Stand Up is where students can get together to enjoy and/or practice the art of stand up comedy. Join us for lots of laughter!

CurrentProjects: Ocean topography class to teach students how to read swell charts, winds, tides in order to understand surf conditions
AboutUs: Surf Club- The SCU Surf Club is an organization of like minded surfers who aim to promote surfing and surf culture as a whole both on and off SCU campus

CurrentProjects: "We are always involved in Hack-a-thons, KEEN innovation challenges, and have side projects were always working on."
AboutUs: Develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship.

The mission of Toastmasters International is based on three core elements: to improve public speaking skills, leadership skills, and to have a great time while doing so as an open and supportive community.

CurrentProjects: We are an events-based club always looking to connect SCU undergraduate women to strong women in the business world.
AboutUs: Undergraduate Women in Business (WiB) is a student-run club that holds events and builds a network to further collegiate women's academic, professional, and social skills. The club promotes gender diversity in the workforce and prepares students for a career in male-dominated fields.

CurrentProjects: Fundraising to raise money for the Shanti Bhavan organization so that they can maintain their current school, open up new schools around India, and sponsor their students to further their education outside of India.
AboutUs: Our mission is to highlight the mistreatment of low-caste children in India's closed stratification system. The Shanti Bhavan organization offers K-12 education with full support. Graduates receive sponsorship for international higher education. With a 98% graduation rate and alumni at top institutions, Shanti Bhavan breaks barriers and transforms lives.

CurrentProjects: 1) Learning about the mind 2) Engaging in community service 3) Connecting with the border Sikh community
AboutUs: Our mission is to allow the SCU community to experience unity through reflection and bonding activities. We are open to all and would like to boost moral of everyone that we connect with!

SHPE SCU is a non-profit academic and professional organization that promotes the enrollment and retention of minorities in an effort to diversify technical fields. SHPE SCU is a student chapter of the national organization by the name of the Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers (www.shpe.org). Studying STEM in Silicon Valley can be overwhelming as a Latine student. SHPE SCU is a familia that helps you find your way. We provide you with the tools and support needed to focus on your ambitions and escape the pressure of going through it alone.

SPS is the premier way to engage with the physics community at SCU. SPS hosts frequent events like Physics Journal Club, field trips, and professional workshops with the primary goal of brining our small community together.

CurrentProjects: Industry Networking Night, Outreach for STEM to young girls, Community building within womxn engineering community.
AboutUs: SWE is an inclusive community that promotes female empowerment by providing professional development and outreach opportunities to encourage the success and growth of future womexn engineers and expand avenues for allyship.

This club’s purpose is to foster a community of people who will participate in events that better our society and allow those who are interested to learn about different ways we can get involved in our local community. It is a casual no-/low-commitment club which meets or hosts events a couple times a month. Open to all sociology majors, minors, or anyone interesting in how society functions.

CurrentProjects: We have taught in approximately seven classrooms this year!
AboutUs: Sprout Up is an environmental education nonprofit and is student-led and based in California and New York City. We go into first and second grade Title 1 public school classrooms to teach concepts in environmental science and sustainability with the goal of inspiring the next generation of environmental stewards. During the earliest stages of their educational development, we encourage kids to think in new ways about the world around them through activities, experiments, and discussions, inspiring them to bring the message of environmental stewardship home to their families and friends. In this way, we cultivate the next generation of passionate caretakers of the Earth and promote sustainability from the youngest members of society up.
ContactName: Jacqueline Thai & Annika Espling; Co-Chapter Directers

AboutUs: At Santa Clara Law, the Student Bar Association (SBA) Executive Board represents the interests of law students in their relationship with faculty administration, alumni, and the surrounding community. Day-to-day responsibilities of the SBA include facilitating student events and communications, of which includes publication of The Grapevine. Furthermore, if you have any questions, comments, concerns, or recommendations, submit a response to SBA’s new anonymous SBA Tip Line form. Additionally, the SBA oversees the function of over 40 law student organizations that are present on-campus. Managing these organizations enriches the career, professional, community, and social offerings for the Santa Clara Law community. They provide for social interaction, community service, and pre-professional activities. All students enrolled at Santa Clara University School of Law are members of the SBA. Nationally, the SBA is a part of the 50,000 member American Bar Association-Law Student Division (ABA-LSD).

ClubName: Student Bar Association at Santa Clara Law
AboutUs: At Santa Clara Law, the Student Bar Association (SBA) Executive Board represents the interests of law students in their relationship with faculty administration, alumni, and the surrounding community. Day-to-day responsibilities of the SBA include facilitating student events and communications, of which includes publication of The Grapevine.

Students for Justice in Palestine (SJP) is a student-run group of students, faculty, staff, and community members at and around Santa Clara University committed to promoting the democratic principles of justice, human rights, liberation, and self-determination for every person and people through the context of the struggle to establish these principles for the Palestinian people regardless of status of residency and/or citizenship.

SSDP as an organization neither condones nor condemns drug use. We use education to empower and give students the tools to make safe choices. We recognize the harmful impacts of the War on Drugs, especially on communities of color and low-income groups, and seek to remedy these effects through education and advocacy. We operate with a value for harm reduction and provide resources to ensure that our fellow students are making safe, informed choices.
Our mission is to be a clear and confident pro-Israel voice on college campuses and to support students in grassroots pro-Israel advocacy. We host events to educate, bond, and fundraise.

Smash at SCU promotes an inclusive and lively environment for competitive and casual players to come together and enjoy the game we all love. We designed our events to improve the game of competitive players as well as providing a place for casual players to play against new opponents.

To acquaint graduate students of the importance of supply chain in organizations today, by conducting events that help graduate students learn about the Supply Chain Industry outside of classroom through factory visits, case study competitions, interactive panels with industry experts and training sessions on essential data analytics tools.
Our club strives to protect the world’s oceans through beach cleanups in the Bay Area and plastic pollution/conservation awareness

ClubName: SVO (Students Veterans Organization at Santa Clara)
CurrentProjects: Developing and establishing a Student Veterans Center, Leadership Retreats
AboutUs: Because the Student Veteran has different needs and concerns than that of a regular student, the mission of the Student Veteran Organization is to serve as advocates for student veterans, in any respect, that attend Santa Clara University by providing essential information and guidance that aids in success and personal growth.

ClubName: Tau Beta Pi, California Zeta, The Engineering Honor Society
CurrentProjects: Developing relationships between top-performing engineers, as well as all of the undergraduate tutoring services for the entire school of engineering.
AboutUs: Tau Beta Pi California Zeta is Santa Clara University's Chapter of the nationally renowned Engineering Honor Society Tau Beta Pi. We serve to recognize outstanding engineers who have both achieved high academic distinction (top 1/8th of their Junior class, or top 1/5th as a Senior), as well as who have portrayed excellent character. Furthermore, we also provide the school of engineering's tutoring services for undergraduate classes.

CurrentProjects: We put on an annual event and fireside chats.
AboutUs: Founded in 1984, TED stands for Technology, Entertainment, and Design, serving to spread ideas in the form of powerful talks about any topic (ranging from science to business to global issues) all around the world. At Santa Clara University, we recognize the desire for students to feel part of a shared community, and we believe bringing people of all majors, backgrounds, and interests together for one evening can ignite an important change in our campus culture.

ClubName: The American Society of Civil Engineers
CurrentProjects: Lunch and Learn Professional Learning Opportunities, ASCE Conference Involvement, Career Fair, Social Opportunities
NationalOrganization: The American Society of Civil Engineers
AboutUs: The SCU Chapter for the American Society of Civil Engineers encourages development of a professional consciousness in the field of civil engineering, affords opportunities for teamwork and congeniality among peers, and provides friendly contact within the engineering profession.

For students who are passionate about reading or are looking to fall back in love with reading, The Books and Tea Club welcomes all SCU students to read, relax, and drink tea together. At the beginning of every quarter our club selects a book through a voting process. Then, we meet every week to read the book together, chat, and drink tea.

BAM is a connected & caring community for 1st Years students to grow with the help of 2nd, 3rd, & 4th Year Mentors! The mission of the Bronco Academy of Mentorship (BAM) is to inspire undergraduate students at Santa Clara University to find themselves as people and better themselves as leaders through the means of: thoughtful introspection, bonding with fellow BAM members, and intentional mentorship from fellow undergraduate students. Join the movement, & #ComeAlive! ❤️‍🔥

The Women’s Network (TWN) was created for ambitious, high-achieving women looking to grow professionally while being uplifted by their community. TWN offers opportunities to gain exposure to the professional world, network with high-profile speakers, and meet peers across their campus and the nation.

CurrentProjects: Creating a safe space for students of color on campus, particularly for those of marginalized status (e.g. black students, identifying as LBGTQ+, first-generation college students). This does not exclude the experiences of others in need -- this is a combined focus based on the strengths and abilities of current board members. We are more than willing to connect and work with others to broaden our outreach!
AboutUs: TLC operates as a safe space for all femme-presenting people on the SCU campus. We focus on social justice and issues that affect our community, but ultimately, TLC works to create a community of solidarity and peace for all non/binary, trans-men, and femme-presenting people of color on campus.

To serve the university by enriching both transfer and current student experiences. Transfer Student Union will organize exciting, memorable, and informative events for the entire SCU transfer community to feel connected to the campus and the student body. We will create a strong sense of support and community while providing peer support and up-to-date information to students who transferred and plan on graduating within two-to-three years. We will also sponsor activities and events that allow students to explore SCU resources and community. Provide guidance, empower, and encourage students to utilize appropriate resources and to self-advocate as they go through their transition to Santa Clara.

UMA’s mission is to help undergraduate students gain insight on marketing-related career paths and appropriate skills through assisting student's efforts to network with alumni and professionals in the marketing world.

CurrentProjects: Annual USAA Gala, UndocuWeek
AboutUs: This club aims to promote and raise awareness of immigration issues on campus in order to create a more immigration-friendly campus by creating coalitions among undocumented students, allies, staff, and faculty. In addition, we will address the needs of undocumented students and allies on campus that are relevant to the current situation/environment/circumstance.

CurrentProjects: Inter-network activities, alumni outreach, professional development, and networking
AboutUs: Unicorn VC Club introduces the VC partner’s insight & vision to Santa Clara University with the Leavey School of Business. Connecting venture capital firms in our alumni base and the Silicon Valley through inter-network activities, alumni outreach, professional development, and networking.

CurrentProjects: We're currently developing a robotic dog, creating tech industry events, launching an educational outreach initiative targeted at elementary and middle students, and taking part in engineering competitions.
AboutUs: Develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship.

CurrentProjects: VGDC is currently working on a 2D action-platformer with flashy combat that goes by the temporary title: "Project D".
AboutUs: Video Game Development Club (VGDC) aims to provide members with a place to meet, discuss, and collaborate with others interested in video game development. Members can join at any experience levels or fields of talent from just getting started with video game development to having made a game. Members can have any level of expertise in 3D modeling, animation, art, sound design, composing, coding, and video game design.

CurrentProjects: Reviving club membership and looking to grow!
AboutUs: This RSO is focused on spreading knowledge about the art and science of wine. Meetings include educational presentations and discussions about topics ranging from fermentation to the varied wine regions of the world, accompanied by aroma-recognition training using sommelier-crafted fragrances. We hope to build a community for students interested in the intricacies of grapes, fermentation, and wines.

CurrentProjects: Fundraising, volunteering, Homelessness Awareness Week.
AboutUs: Every Friday Vinnies prepares food, water, and care product bags, then delivers them to the houseless in and around St. James Park. Volunteers are also encouraged to converse and connect with this community. Our hope is to provide a way for the underserved to have people they can form connections and foster an environment where there is hope. We also collaborate with other clubs and organizations on campus to put on clothing drives, food making events, and deliveries.

ClubName: Volunteers Around the World Global Health Alliances
AboutUs: Volunteers Around the World Global Health Alliances is a student-run organization that serves to advance interest in the field of medicine through the philanthropic promotion of health in countries across the world.

CurrentProjects: - "Professional networking events, resume-building, and female empowerment events. " - “How to work well during the pandemic.”
AboutUs: A network of collegiate women empowering each other and laying the foundation for professional development.

CurrentProjects: Currently, we are involved in creating woman-founder panels, networking, as well as joining forces with Women in Business and Women in Investing for future events.
AboutUs: WE want to educate, support, and motivate more young women to pursue their entrepreneurial endeavors in any type of field, such as STEM, lifestyle, cosmetics, etc., gain the confidence to start their own company, and provide a welcoming sisterhood for help and advice. Our goal is to provide the women on SCU’s campus to have a community where they can openly share their ideas and gain the support they need to start a business.

Our club works to bring together women who are interested in the field of physics and go to Santa Clara. We host events to help support our members academically/career wise, but also social events to create a good community.

CurrentProjects: Some of our recent events include resume and interview workshops, study days, trivia nights, and information sessions. We hope to create a strong network within and beyond SCU that will encourage, support, and recruit female undergraduate students to pursue careers in STEM.
AboutUs: Our goal is to cultivate an uplifting community where female undergraduate students majoring in STEM fields can come together to support each other and explore various careers in the computer science, mathematics, engineering, public health, chemistry, biology, and biotechnology fields.

CurrentProjects: 1. Fostering women's and men's community groups alongside weekly meetings. 2. Developing an active team for Wyldlife (Young Life leaders for middle school students 3. Developing an active team for Young Life High School (Saratoga and Los Gatos)
AboutUs: The purpose of the Chapter is to participate in the Young Life mission of introducing adolescents to Jesus Christ and helping them grow in their Christian faith.  This Chapter achieves this purpose by offering a fun, accepting community for college students to be a part of while exploring or deepening their own Christian faith, providing opportunities for college students to engage in Young Life ministry to local middle school and high school students, and offering activities like weekly club meetings, small group Bible studies, and community service opportunities in an effort to positively impact the campus and surrounding community.
